description: Redevelopment of the site to provide new retail and office floorpsace and 13 residential units including 4 x 1 bed flats, 6 x 2 bed units and 3 x 3 bed units in a building comprising basement and eight storeys above, following demolition of the existing building
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - Typical design details (both in plan and section) showing all facing materials and finishes for the Farringdon Road facade shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - A sample panel of the facing materials shall be provided on site and approved by the Council before the relevant parts of the works are commenced and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approval given. The sample panel shall be retained on site until the work has been completed.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - The details of the shopfront including facing materials to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - Before the use commences all plant and machinery shall be sound insulated and isolated from the structure such that the use can be carried out without detriment to the amenity of adjoining of adjoining or surrounding premises. The use shall thereafter not be carried out other than in complete compliance with the  scheme of sound insulation.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 6 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the building, the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policyies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - Before the development is occupied the service bay within the site shall be clearly marked out in thermoplastic paint stating "No Parking". Thereafter, at no time shall any goods, vehicles, plant equipment or other obstruction be left in this area and the markings shall be permanently maintained and retained unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: In order to satisfactorily provide for the turning of vehicles within the site and in the interests of highways and pedestrian safety in accordance with policy TR23 and DS9 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 8 - Details of screens to be erected on balconies, including their height, detailed design and location, shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council,  prior to the occupation of the residential units and shall be permanently retained and maintained thereafter. 

Reason: In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring residential units in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 9 - The areas shown for cycle parking in the basement shall be permanently maintained and retained for the residential occupiers of the building unless prior written consent is obtained from the Council.   

Reason: To ensure that the Council is satisfied that cycle facilities are provided within the building in accordance with policy TR22 and DS8 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 10 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which is not as such as could be carried on or installed in any residential area without detriment to the amenity of that area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke, soot, ash, dust or grit. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 11 - The areas shown for refuse storage in the basement for both the residential and Class B1(offices) uses shall be permanently maintained and retained for that purpose unless prior written consent is given by the Council.  

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 12 - Before the Class A1 (retail) use commences, an area for the storage of refuse (including recycled materials) shall be provided and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the building and the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 13 - No material operation within the meaning of section 56(4) of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 shall be commenced on the site except in accordance with the plans, specifications and detailed design method statements which have been submitted to and approved by Cross London Rail Links Limited and the development so permitted shall be carried out only in accordance with the plans, specifications and detailed desing method statements so approved. 

Reason: To safeguard the proposed Crossrail alignment in accordance with paragraph 5(b) of the Safeguarding Directions issued under articles 14(1) and 18(3) of the Town & Country Planning General Development Order 1988 , and in accordance with the requirements of policy TR5 and as set out in T2 of the Schedule of Transport Proposals,  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 14 - No work to construction the foundations of the development shall commence until the existing piled foundations have been removed in accordance with the plans, specifications and detailed design statement which shall be submitted to and approved by Cross London Rail Links Ltd.

Reason: To safeguard the proposed Crossrail alignment in accordance with paragraph 5(b) of the Safeguarding Directions issued under articles 14(1) and 18(3) of the Town & Country Planning General Development Order 1988 , and in accordance with the requirements of policy TR5 and as set out in T2 of the Schedule of Transport Proposals,  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 15 - No construction of temporary works more than three metres below ground leel shall be commenced until plans, specifications and detailed design method statements for foundations of any such temporary works have been submitted to and approved by Cross Rial Links Ltd. 

Reason: To safeguard the proposed Crossrail alignment in accordance with paragraph 5(b) of the Safeguarding Directions issued under articles 14(1) and 18(3) of the Town & Country Planning General Development Order 1988 , and in accordance with the requirements of policy TR5 and as set out in T2 of the Schedule of Transport Proposals,  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
